content: Is aesop/aesop_cat not able to use local simp lemmas? By adding 3 local simp lemmas, I am able to prove a theorem using ext <;> simp, but aesop/aesop_cat is not able to prove this. Is this because aesop can't use local simp lemmas? Is there a way which I can add these (locally) to aesop as well?
This wasn’t clear from your question: Does aesop work if you use attribute [simp] instead of attribute [local simp]?
Actually it doesn't! Sorry about that. I just didn't even consider that aesop could fail to solve something which is literally just ext and simp
The ext lemma that it needs to use is defined in the same file (by me) so maybe the error is with that somehow
I have used attribute [local simp] many times in order to make aesop_cat work. However, there are cases where ext <;> simp works but aesop_cat does not (or is much slower).
Yes, this is a pity. I do wish aesop were strictly more powerful than ext <;> simp!
